title: Commending Firefighter and Out-Going President Roy R. Fries upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  Firefighter and Out-Going President
Roy R. Fries upon the occasion of his designation for  special  recogni-
tion  after  47 years of dedicated service to the North Lindenhurst Fire
Department

WHEREAS, The firefighters of New York State are renowned throughout  the
Nation;  their  reputation  is synonymous with excellence in the arduous
field of fire protection and prevention; and
  WHEREAS, Since the early days  of  "teapot  steamers,"  the  volunteer
firefighter  has  been  the cornerstone of our great Nation's efforts to
spare us from the ravages of fire; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is proud to commend  Firefighter  Chief
Roy  R.  Fries upon the occasion of his designation for special recogni-
tion after 47 years of dedicated service to the North  Lindenhurst  Fire
Department; and
  WHEREAS,  Since  entering  the  North Lindenhurst Fire Department as a
firefighter, Roy R. Fries has worked his way up the ranks, holding  many
prestigious  positions  including  Lieutenant, Deputy Chief, Chief, Vice
President and ultimately President of the Department; and
  WHEREAS, Roy R. Fries  has  made  many  contributions  to  his  field,
including  obtaining  a much needed new ambulance for the department, as
well as acting as a liaison between Nassau/Suffolk  Fire  Department  to
coordinate blood service to emergency incidents; and
  WHEREAS,  In  addition,  Roy  R.  Fries served as President of Babylon
Central Fire Alarm where he worked with Town  of  Babylon  fire  depart-
ments,  corporations,  villages  and  attorneys  regarding  the new laws
enacted that impact fire departments and volunteer firefighters; and
  WHEREAS, Roy R. Fries has initiated several valuable  public  relation
programs  including  prostate  screenings, informing residents of carbon
monoxide dangers and its prevention,  as  well  as  offering  first  aid
classes  to local Girl Scouts and Little League coaches; he also secured
a grant for the purchase of a safety hazard  hose  enhancing  the  North
Lindenhurst Fire Department Fire Prevention program; and
  WHEREAS,  In  1975, Roy R. Fries was honored with the esteemed Fireman
of the Year Award for heroically saving a life in the line of duty; and
  WHEREAS, Furthermore, Roy  R.  Fries  is  personally  responsible  for
establishing  a  softball  team as well as a Junior Drill Team named the
Piston Knockers, which made it to the New York State  Championship  four
years in a row; and
  WHEREAS,  Volunteer firefighters and fire departments not only provide
the critical service of fire protection but also engage in other  activ-
ities of great benefit and importance to the communities they serve; and
  WHEREAS, It takes a special dedication, a strong desire to help others
and  a  tireless sense of community to forsake precious time with family
and friends to respond to the signal that a neighbor is in need; Roy  R.
Fries  is  such  a  firefighter; throughout 47 years of devoted service,
this volunteer heroically performed, above and beyond the call of  duty,
those  responsibilities  which  define the task of fire protection; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That this Legislative Body pause in  its  deliberations  to
commend  Firefighter  Roy  R.  Fries  for  many  years  of distinguished
service; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Roy R. Fries.
